meanings.definition: A noun meaning a container or box used for storing items in a disorganized or chaotic manner.
meanings.sent1: The garage was full of old hellboxes filled with tools and toys.
meanings.sent2: She stacked the hellboxes in the corner of the room to clear up space.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the hellboxes, it created a mess of scattered items.
meanings.sent4: The attic was a labyrinth of dusty hellboxes, each holding forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent5: The moving truck was packed with hellboxes, each holding memories of a different time.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to place items in a disorderly or messy fashion in a container or box.
meanings.sent1: He would always hellboxes his tools after a long day of work.
meanings.sent2: The kids loved to hellboxes their toys into colorful bins.
meanings.sent3: She decided to hellboxes her jewelry in a shoebox, much to her cat's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The students rushed to hellboxes their books into their backpacks before the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The chef would carefully hellboxes his spices in labeled containers for easy access.
